Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Kforce is immediately seeking an experienced Data Analyst in support of our enterprise telecommunications and mass media client based in Greenwood Village, CO. Key Tasks:


Performs data collection, analysis, validation and reporting
Designs, tests, and documents processes, SQL queries, and stored procedures
Extracts and analyzes data from various sources, including databases, manual files, and external websites
Responds to data inquiries from various groups within an organization
Creates and publishes regularly scheduled and ad hoc reports
Documents reporting requirements and processes and validates data components as required
Requires experience with relational databases and knowledge of query tools and/or statistical software
Design and build custom applications using Microsoft Power Apps (Canvas and Model-driven apps)
Automate workflows and business processes using Power Automate. Integrate Power Apps with SharePoint, Dynamics 365, Microsoft Teams, Dataverse, and other data sources (SQL Server, Excel, APIs)
Develop custom connectors, components, and logic as needed
Work with stakeholders to gather requirements, propose solutions, and deliver user-centric apps
Maintain documentation of apps, workflows, and configurations
Monitor and troubleshoot Power Apps solutions to ensure optimal performance


Requirements


0 - 2 years of experience
Hands-on experience with Power Automate, SharePoint, and proven experience building apps in Microsoft Power Apps
Strong analytical and organizational skills required
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Part-Time Data Analyst

Location: Remote

Company: Ascot Group

Job Type: Part-Time

Department: Data & Analytics / Business Intelligence

Reports To: Data Analytics Manager / Director of Data Strategy

About Ascot Group

Ascot Group is a leading global specialty insurance and reinsurance organization. With a commitment to underwriting discipline, data-driven insights, and innovative thinking, we deliver exceptional value and protection to clients worldwide. At Ascot, we combine the strength of tradition with a modern approach, fostering a culture where collaboration and analytical excellence drive business success.

Position Summary

Ascot Group is seeking a motivated and analytical Part-Time Data Analyst to support our growing Data & Analytics team. This role is ideal for someone with a strong foundation in data analysis and visualization, who is looking to contribute impactful insights in a flexible, part-time capacity. You'll work with cross-functional teams to help transform data into actionable intelligence, supporting strategic decision-making across the organization.

Key Responsibilities

Collect, clean, and analyze data from multiple internal and external sources
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Excel
Translate complex datasets into clear, concise business insights for stakeholders
Identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities to improve underwriting, risk management, and operational efficiency
Assist in data quality assurance and process improvement initiatives
Collaborate with IT, Underwriting, and other business units to align analytics with strategic goals
Support ad hoc reporting and analysis requests

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree (or pursuing a degree) in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field
1–2 years of experience in a data analytics or reporting role preferred (internship or part-time experience welcome)
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and at least one data visualization tool (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker)
Familiarity with Python, R, or similar tools for data manipulation and analysis is a plus
Strong analytical thinking and attention to detail
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Self-starter with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment

What We Offer

Competitive hourly compensation
Flexible part-time hours (approx. 15–25 hours/week)
Opportunity to work in a global, data-driven insurance environment
Learning and development support with exposure to real-world analytics challenges
Collaborative and supportive team culture

Join Our Team

At Ascot Group, data is at the heart of our decision-making. If you’re passionate about uncovering insights, solving business problems, and working with a mission-driven organization, we invite you to apply.

Title: Retail Site Data Analyst
Description:
Salary Range Minimum

65,640

Salary Range Maximum

109,200




Be part of an amazing story

Macy’s is more than just a store. We’re a story. One that’s captured the hearts and minds of America for more than 160 years. A story about innovations and traditions…about inspiring stores and irresistible products…about the excitement of the Macy’s 4th of July Fireworks, and the wonder of the Thanksgiving Day Parade. We’ve been part of memorable moments and milestones for countless customers and colleagues. Those stories are part of what makes this such a special place to work.

Job Overview

The Attribution Specialist at Macy's is responsible for optimizing attribution strategies to enhance product discoverability on the website. This role involves defining processes, collaborating with various teams, and ensuring accurate data management to improve the overall site merchandising experience. The Attribution Specialist will support an offshore team onboarding & optimizing product on Macys.com. A successful candidate will possess strong analytical skills, organizational abilities, and a collaborative mindset. This role reports to the Senior Manager – PDP Optimization.

What You Will Do

Serve as a subject matter expert on attribution strategies and best practices.
Collaborate with business teams to establish business rules for automated attribution tagging.
Manage backend data impacting on-site experiences, including new attribution and size mappings.
Collaborate with the Marketplace team on taxonomy changes and ensure all data systems reflect up to date attribution strategies.
Investigate data issues and track resolutions through JIRA.
Support and monitor output from the offshore team onboarding over 100K products annually.
Foster an environment of acceptance and respect that strengthens relationships, and ensures authentic connections with colleagues, customers, and communities.
In addition to the essential duties mentioned above, other duties may be assigned.

Skills You Will Need

BA/BS Degree or equivalent experience.
1-2 years of related experience in retail, site merchandising, or analytics.
Strong communication and collaboration skills with cross-functional partners.
Ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize effectively.
Creative and strategic problem-solving skills.
Flexibility in work schedule based on department needs.
System Knowledge: Stella, PDS, Stipo, Facet, Jira




Who You Are

Candidates with a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in a related field are encouraged to apply.
Regularly required to sit, talk, hear; use hands/fingers to touch, handle, and feel. Occasionally required to move about the workplace and reach with hands and arms. Requires close vision.
Able to work a flexible schedule based on department and company needs.

What We Can Offer You

Join a team where work is as rewarding as it is fun! We offer a dynamic, inclusive environment with competitive pay and benefits. Enjoy comprehensive health and wellness coverage and a 401(k) match to invest in your future. Prioritize your well-being with paid time off and eight paid holidays. Grow your career with continuous learning and leadership development. Plus, build community by joining one of our Colleague Resource Groups and make a difference through our volunteer opportunities.

Some additional benefits we offer include:

Merchandise discounts
Performance-based incentives
Annual merit review
Employee Assistance Program with mental health counseling and legal/financial advice
Tuition reimbursement

Access the full menu of benefits offerings here.

About Us

This is a great time to join Macy’s! Whether you’re helping a customer find the perfect gift, streamlining operations in one of our distribution centers, enhancing our online shopping experience, buying in-style and on-trend merchandise to outfit our customers, or designing a balloon for the Thanksgiving Day Parade, we offer unique opportunities to be part of some of the most memorable moments in people’s lives.

Join us and help write the next chapter in our story - apply today!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position Description

Are you a talented Data Analyst looking for an exciting opportunity to showcase your skills and make a real impact? Join our dynamic team and take on the challenge of supporting the implementation of a client-specific business intelligence solution for our Federal client. As a key partner of our BI team, you will collaborate closely with our implementation team and client to ensure our clients receive the customized solutions they need. This is a high-stakes, mission-critical project where you will have the opportunity to work alongside a talented group of individuals, pushing the boundaries of innovation. Don't miss out on this chance to be part of something exceptional!

This position is located in our Arlington, VA office; however, a hybrid working model is acceptable.

Your future duties and responsibilities


Evaluate quality of complex, disparate financial data using SQL and perform data analysis techniques that improve client-reporting capabilities.
Understand data needs and construct data pipelines for automating data preparation.
Understand functional reporting requirements and translate into technical requirements for a Business Intelligence application.
Identify database elements (tables, views, etc.), and business logic to build report design specifications to the client’s requirements.
Create report prototypes through functions, scripts, and stored procedures.
Improve and refine SQL queries.
Troubleshoot and validate data as required.
Demonstrate in-depth technical capabilities with the ability to support multiple work streams and drive assimilation of new techniques and solutions.
Be passionate about technology trends.


Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role


Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Technology or STEM related discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience.
4 Years of experience with hands-on SQL development, including creating complex SQL queries and functions, and data structures.
4 years of Business Intelligence (BI) experience.
Experience using scripting languages (e.g. Python, PowerShell, Perl) to extract data.
Experience working in an Agile based environment.
Knowledge of data warehousing best-practices including ETL and/or EII tools, database architecture, and SDLC methodologies.


CGI is required by law in some jurisdictions to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. The determination of this range includes various factors not limited to skill set, level, experience, relevant training, and licensure and certifications. To support the ability to reward for merit-based performance, CGI typically does not hire individuals at or near the top of the range for their role. Compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range for this role in the U.S. is $61,900.00 - $150,800.00.

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That’s why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company’s strategy and direction.

HTML:
Position Description

Are you a talented Data Analyst looking for an exciting opportunity to showcase your skills and make a real impact? Join our dynamic team and take on the challenge of supporting the implementation of a client-specific business intelligence solution for our Federal client. As a key partner of our BI team, you will collaborate closely with our implementation team and client to ensure our clients receive the customized solutions they need. This is a high-stakes, mission-critical project where you will have the opportunity to work alongside a talented group of individuals, pushing the boundaries of innovation. Don't miss out on this chance to be part of something exceptional!

This position is located in our Arlington, VA office; however, a hybrid working model is acceptable.

Your future duties and responsibilities

  • Evaluate quality of complex, disparate financial data using SQL and perform data analysis techniques that improve client-reporting capabilities.
  • Understand data needs and construct data pipelines for automating data preparation.
  • Understand functional reporting requirements and translate into technical requirements for a Business Intelligence application.
  • Identify database elements (tables, views, etc.), and business logic to build report design specifications to the client’s requirements.
  • Create report prototypes through functions, scripts, and stored procedures.
  • Improve and refine SQL queries.
  • Troubleshoot and validate data as required.
  • Demonstrate in-depth technical capabilities with the ability to support multiple work streams and drive assimilation of new techniques and solutions.
  • Be passionate about technology trends.

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

  • Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Technology or STEM related discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience.
  • 4 Years of experience with hands-on SQL development, including creating complex SQL queries and functions, and data structures.
  • 4 years of Business Intelligence (BI) experience.
  • Experience using scripting languages (e.g. Python, PowerShell, Perl) to extract data.
  • Experience working in an Agile based environment.
  • Knowledge of data warehousing best-practices including ETL and/or EII tools, database architecture, and SDLC methodologies.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Part-Time Data Analyst

Location: Remote

Company: Ascot Group

Job Type: Part-Time

Department: Data & Analytics / Business Intelligence

Reports To: Data Analytics Manager / Director of Data Strategy

About Ascot Group

Ascot Group is a leading global specialty insurance and reinsurance organization. With a commitment to underwriting discipline, data-driven insights, and innovative thinking, we deliver exceptional value and protection to clients worldwide. At Ascot, we combine the strength of tradition with a modern approach, fostering a culture where collaboration and analytical excellence drive business success.

Position Summary

Ascot Group is seeking a motivated and analytical Part-Time Data Analyst to support our growing Data & Analytics team. This role is ideal for someone with a strong foundation in data analysis and visualization, who is looking to contribute impactful insights in a flexible, part-time capacity. You'll work with cross-functional teams to help transform data into actionable intelligence, supporting strategic decision-making across the organization.

Key Responsibilities

Collect, clean, and analyze data from multiple internal and external sources
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations using tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Excel
Translate complex datasets into clear, concise business insights for stakeholders
Identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities to improve underwriting, risk management, and operational efficiency
Assist in data quality assurance and process improvement initiatives
Collaborate with IT, Underwriting, and other business units to align analytics with strategic goals
Support ad hoc reporting and analysis requests

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree (or pursuing a degree) in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field
1–2 years of experience in a data analytics or reporting role preferred (internship or part-time experience welcome)
Proficiency in SQL, Excel, and at least one data visualization tool (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker)
Familiarity with Python, R, or similar tools for data manipulation and analysis is a plus
Strong analytical thinking and attention to detail
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Self-starter with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment

What We Offer

Competitive hourly compensation
Flexible part-time hours (approx. 15–25 hours/week)
Opportunity to work in a global, data-driven insurance environment
Learning and development support with exposure to real-world analytics challenges
Collaborative and supportive team culture

Join Our Team

At Ascot Group, data is at the heart of our decision-making. If you’re passionate about uncovering insights, solving business problems, and working with a mission-driven organization, we invite you to apply.

Title: Data Engineer – Entry Level (Remote)
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting, enabling clients in over 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation. The AWS and Snowflake Data Engineer will be responsible for interfacing with key stakeholders, applying technical proficiency across different stages of the Software Development Life Cycle, and contributing to technology-specific best practices and standards.




Responsibilities:

• Enable digital transformation for our clients in a global delivery model

• Research on technologies independently

• Recommend appropriate solutions

• Contribute to technology-specific best practices and standards

• Interface with key stakeholders

• Apply your technical proficiency across different stages of the Software Development Life Cycle




Qualifications:




Required:

• Candidate must be located within commuting distance of Raleigh, NC or Richardson, TX or be willing to relocate to the area. This position may require travel in the US

• Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education.

• All applicants authorized to work in the United States are encouraged to apply

• At least 2 years of Information Technology experience

• At least 1 years of AWS experience

• At least 1 years of Snowflake experience

• Experience in end-to-end implementation using technologies such as AWS and Snowflake

• Strong knowledge and hands-on experience in SQL, Unix shell scripting, and Python




Preferred:

• Experience in Banking/Financial domain

• Strong knowledge Data structures, Data Engineering concepts, Algorithms, Collections, Multi-threading and memory management and concurrency

• Experience in large scale cloud data migrations using Snowflake, Python, Spark, SQL

• Sound knowledge of software engineering design patterns and practices

• Good understanding of Agile software development frameworks

• Strong communication and Analytical skills

• Good to have experience in Azure/AWS Databricks

• Ability to work in teams in a diverse, multi-stakeholder environment comprising of Business and Technology teams




Company:

Infosys is a technology company that offers consulting, outsourcing, cloud infrastructure, program management, and software services. Founded in 1981, the company is headquartered in Bangalore, Karnataka, IND, with a team of 10001+ employees. The company is currently .

Title: Associate, Data Steward (Remote)
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

Jenius Bank is a digital banking business of Manufacturers Bank, focused on building a full-service digital bank. The Associate, Data Steward role serves as a critical liaison to ensure effective data governance across the enterprise, advising on data standards and practices while validating data quality.




Responsibilities:

• Provide guidance to business unit leaders on the implementation and enforcement of data governance policies and standards.

• Develop and maintain authoritative documentation, including data dictionaries, relational data models, and lineage maps to ensure consistent data definitions and relationships across systems.

• Approve structural changes to data assets, ensuring alignment with enterprise standards and governance requirements.

• Audit data sources to validate accuracy, completeness, and compliance with defined quality standards.

• Analyze reporting on data quality and policy compliance to recommend enhancements to governance procedures.

• Design and oversee data storage architectures with a focus on minimizing redundancy and ensuring seamless integration across platforms.

• Collaborate with compliance teams to assess data retention and access policies, ensuring alignment with regulatory and risk management requirements.

• Work in partnership with IT and database administrators to design and maintain secure, scalable, and compliant data structures.

• Coordinate with business stakeholders to formalize data input protocols and usage guidelines that promote data integrity and accountability.

• Lead or support training initiatives to promote awareness and adoption of data standards across teams.

• Engage with application development teams to implement tools and automation that reinforce data accuracy, standardization, and usability.

• Exhibit in-depth knowledge of industry regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and leading practices in data governance.

• Demonstrate advanced proficiency in enterprise data architecture, integration solutions, and quality assurance frameworks.

• Maintain strong familiarity with key corporate data sources and operational processes to provide actionable recommendations on data strategy and policy.

• Facilitate cross-functional data initiatives, ensuring alignment to enterprise data governance goals and consistent adherence to standards.




Qualifications:




Required:

• Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in data governance, data stewardship, or a related technical data management role.

• Expertise in data architecture, metadata management, master data management, and data quality tools.

• Strong analytical skills, with the ability to translate complex data issues into clear action plans.

• Experience working in hybrid data environments (e.g., cloud-based and on-premise systems).

• Proven ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams including IT, compliance, and business stakeholders.




Company:

Jenius Bank is a digital banking business of Manufacturers Bank. It is a sub-organization of Manufacturers Bank. Founded in , the company is headquartered in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA, with a team of 201-500 employees. The company is currently Growth Stage. Jenius Bank has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: Data Visualization Intern - iDeas Lab (Fall 2025)
Description:
Job Summary

The Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) is a non-profit, bipartisan public policy organization established in 1962 to provide strategic insights and practical policy solutions to decision-makers concerned with global security and prosperity. Over the years, it has grown to be one of the largest organizations of its kind, with a staff of some 275 employees, including more than 120 analysts working to address the changing dynamics of international security across the globe.

The Andreas C. Dracopoulos iDeas Lab, the award-winning creative and digital production department at CSIS, continues to be the gold standard for innovation in the global think tank space by using cutting-edge multimedia production to bring policy research to life.

The iDeas Lab enhances CSIS's policy research and analysis with the latest in web development, design, video, and audio. You can see some of our work at ideaslab.csis.org or www.github.com/CSIS-iLab.

The data visualization intern will translate datasets into graphs, charts, and other data visualizations to be featured in CSIS’s premiere product – our publications. The core of this position is to process data and quickly produce relevant data visualizations. You will work in a creative environment with other designers who are eager to bring information to life on the web and across platforms, partnering with some of the most respected foreign policy experts and researchers.

The ideal candidate has solid data visualization background and communication skills. They also bring a passion for bridging the intersection between data, design, technology, and foreign policy/national security.

The successful candidate will be eager to improve their skills and contribute to CSIS’s vision of telling fact-based public policy stories. The candidate will have strong problem-solving skills and independent self-direction, coupled with an aptitude for design and collaboration with a multi-disciplinary team. Additionally, the candidate will be a team player, possess outstanding communication and project management skills, and the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced and innovative environment while meeting tight deadlines.

The hired candidate will be paid hourly, commensurate with experience ($18.00/hour for current undergraduate hires, $19.00/hour for hires with a bachelor’s degree, and $20.00/hour for hires with a master’s degree).

Eessential Duities An Responsibilities

Essential functions may include, but are not limited to the following


Design data visualizations using Flourish and Datawrapper. Create infographics.
Help researchers, analysts, and non-technical partners to effectively communicate their findings using data.
Work closely with iDeas Lab designers to merge data visualizations with the layout of publications.
Support the team to gather feedback from clients and partners to continually improve the products and tools we create.
Support the design, layout, and illustration of communication materials for print and digital platforms, including reports and presentations.


Knowledge, education, and experience


B.A./B.S./A.B. in relevant field (information design, data visualization, computer science, graphic design) or other relevant experience, including bootcamp training or freelance work.
1+ years of experience in data visualization design.
Solid understanding of data visualization design best practices and general design principles.
Proficiency with Adobe Creative Cloud applications (Illustrator), HTML5, and CSS3/SASS.
Experience in receiving feedback gracefully, knowing how to respond appropriately to client concerns and how to iterate and improve designs based on feedback.
Strong interest in global affairs and public policy.


SOME TECHNOLOGIES WE USE IN THE iDEAS LAB


Flourish and Datawrapper
Adobe C Suite, JS libraries and frameworks like React, Vue, Highcharts, D3, and jQuery
Mapping tools like Mapbox, Leaflet and Carto
Typefi


You don’t need to be proficient in all of these, but familiarity with some is a plus and a willingness to learn is key.

Physical requirements and work conditions

The physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee working in an office environment. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Equal Opportunity Employer.

How to apply

Interested applicants should submit via careers.csis.org.

To submit an application for this position, click the “Apply” button below, and you will be redirected to our secure recruitment portal.

CSIS is a bipartisan, nonprofit organization headquartered in Washington, D.C. The Center’s 220 full-time staff and large network of affiliated scholars conduct research and analysis and develop policy initiatives that look to the future and anticipate change.

HTML:
Job Summary

The Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) is a non-profit, bipartisan public policy organization established in 1962 to provide strategic insights and practical policy solutions to decision-makers concerned with global security and prosperity. Over the years, it has grown to be one of the largest organizations of its kind, with a staff of some 275 employees, including more than 120 analysts working to address the changing dynamics of international security across the globe.

The Andreas C. Dracopoulos iDeas Lab, the award-winning creative and digital production department at CSIS, continues to be the gold standard for innovation in the global think tank space by using cutting-edge multimedia production to bring policy research to life.

The iDeas Lab enhances CSIS's policy research and analysis with the latest in web development, design, video, and audio. You can see some of our work at ideaslab.csis.org or www.github.com/CSIS-iLab.

The data visualization intern will translate datasets into graphs, charts, and other data visualizations to be featured in CSIS’s premiere product – our publications. The core of this position is to process data and quickly produce relevant data visualizations. You will work in a creative environment with other designers who are eager to bring information to life on the web and across platforms, partnering with some of the most respected foreign policy experts and researchers.

The ideal candidate has solid data visualization background and communication skills. They also bring a passion for bridging the intersection between data, design, technology, and foreign policy/national security.

The successful candidate will be eager to improve their skills and contribute to CSIS’s vision of telling fact-based public policy stories. The candidate will have strong problem-solving skills and independent self-direction, coupled with an aptitude for design and collaboration with a multi-disciplinary team. Additionally, the candidate will be a team player, possess outstanding communication and project management skills, and the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced and innovative environment while meeting tight deadlines.

The hired candidate will be paid hourly, commensurate with experience ($18.00/hour for current undergraduate hires, $19.00/hour for hires with a bachelor’s degree, and $20.00/hour for hires with a master’s degree).

Eessential Duities An Responsibilities

Essential functions may include, but are not limited to the following

  • Design data visualizations using Flourish and Datawrapper. Create infographics.
  • Help researchers, analysts, and non-technical partners to effectively communicate their findings using data.
  • Work closely with iDeas Lab designers to merge data visualizations with the layout of publications.
  • Support the team to gather feedback from clients and partners to continually improve the products and tools we create.
  • Support the design, layout, and illustration of communication materials for print and digital platforms, including reports and presentations.

Knowledge, education, and experience

  • B.A./B.S./A.B. in relevant field (information design, data visualization, computer science, graphic design) or other relevant experience, including bootcamp training or freelance work.
  • 1+ years of experience in data visualization design.
  • Solid understanding of data visualization design best practices and general design principles.
  • Proficiency with Adobe Creative Cloud applications (Illustrator), HTML5, and CSS3/SASS.
  • Experience in receiving feedback gracefully, knowing how to respond appropriately to client concerns and how to iterate and improve designs based on feedback.
  • Strong interest in global affairs and public policy.

SOME TECHNOLOGIES WE USE IN THE iDEAS LAB

  • Flourish and Datawrapper
  • Adobe C Suite, JS libraries and frameworks like React, Vue, Highcharts, D3, and jQuery
  • Mapping tools like Mapbox, Leaflet and Carto
  • Typefi

You don’t need to be proficient in all of these, but familiarity with some is a plus and a willingness to learn is key.

Physical requirements and work conditions

The physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee working in an office environment. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Equal Opportunity Employer.

How to apply

Interested applicants should submit via careers.csis.org.

To submit an application for this position, click the “Apply” button below, and you will be redirected to our secure recruitment portal.

Title: Researcher
Description:
POWERING CRYPTO WITH DATA

CoinMarketCap is the world’s most trusted and accurate source of data for cryptocurrencies. Used by millions of individuals, organizations, and exchanges, CoinMarketCap brings the most up-to-date market capitalizations, pricing, and cryptocurrency information to our users.

Pulling data from multiple exchanges and combining our robust research allows us to provide the most realistic representation of each cryptocurrency. As we grow, we will continue to provide access to our data wherever, whenever, and however is most helpful to our users.

CREATING AN OPEN WORLD

Our mission is to be the world’s authority on cryptocurrency data.

We believe in an open and decentralized world, where we play a pivotal role in powering decisions and insights to drive greater understanding and adoption of cryptocurrencies. We want to achieve this mission with people who truly believe in the value and potential of empowering individuals.

Role & Responsibilities


Produce insightful crypto research covering thematic trends, protocol and ecosystem overview, and on-chain data analytics utilizing various data tools to write and produce industry-leading insights cited by news outlets and KOLs.
Coordinate with CMC research partners, act as liaison externally and internally across marketing, PR, design, data and editing teams to manage research projects, and help maintain the research pipeline on CMC Research website.
Work cross-functionally with the Product, Tech, Marketing, Data and Design teams, lead research related projects and initiatives. Acquire a deep understanding of aspects of the crypto industry including technology, legal, regulatory, economic, and protocol details. Track developments across multiple blockchain ecosystems to spot incipient trends and formulate strategies to capitalize on them.


Skills & Requirements


Passion for cryptoassets
Experience researching and writing concise summaries; editing skills
Strong market sense and experience in the crypto ecosystem
Ability to synthesize complex topics and provide concise summaries for readers
Self-motivated individual who can work with minimal supervision and thrive in a distributed and multicultural team setting
Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills; Business Development/ Account Management skills required for maintaining research partnerships.
Strong attention to detail and consistency
Data science/analytics background would be a bonus


Apply for this job

Title: Data Engineer (Data Science and AI) [REMOTE]
Description:
Job Description




We are seeking a highly skilled BI Developer with expertise in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Data Science to join our team.
The successful candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and deploying data visualizations and business intelligence solutions using Modern BI tools while leveraging AI and machine learning techniques to drive insights and decision-making. If you have a passion for data analysis, AI, and data visualization, and are looking for a challenging and rewarding role, we encourage you to apply.



Key Responsibilities



Design, develop, and deploy data visualizations and business intelligence solutions using Power BI, Tableau or other tools.
Work with stakeholders to understand business requirements and develop solutions that meet their needs
Leverage AI and machine learning techniques to analyze and visualize complex data sets
Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to integrate AI and machine learning models into Power BI solutions
Develop and maintain data pipelines and architectures to support data visualization and business intelligence solutions
Ensure data quality, security, and compliance with organizational standards and policies
Stay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in AI, data science, and data visualization




Required Education, Experience, & Skills



3+ years of experience in BI development, with a focus on data visualization and business intelligence
2+ years of experience in AI and data science, with a focus on machine learning and data analysis
Strong understanding of data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL processes
Experience with Power BI tools, including Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service, and Power BI Embedded
Proficiency in programming languages, such as Python, R, or SQL
Strong proficiency in SQL and database design principles
Experience with machine learning frameworks, such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch
Strong understanding of data visualization principles and best practices
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work with stakeholders and technical teams
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field + 4 years work experience




Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills



Experience with data engineering, data warehousing, and ETL processes.
Knowledge of cloud-based data platforms, such as AWS or Azure
Experience with data governance and data quality frameworks
Certification in Power BI, AI, or data science, such as Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate or Certified Data Scientist



Pay Information

Full-Time Salary Range: $77814 - $132283

Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.

Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics.



About BAE Systems, Inc.


BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference.

This position will be posted for at least 5 calendar days. The posting will remain active until the position is filled, or a qualified pool of candidates is identified.

Title: Systems Analyst – Entry Level (Remote)
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

Global Relay has been a leader in enterprise information archiving for over 20 years, providing solutions for highly regulated firms. The Systems Analyst will support the Data Services Department by implementing data management requests, troubleshooting issues, and ensuring data integrity while contributing to the development of internal products.




Responsibilities:

• Technical Review, validate, approve and complete Data Service requests, according to departmental SLAs

• Investigate and troubleshoot product, system and data errors

• Maintain and update server hardware/software as needed

• Run SQL (or SQL-similar) queries for custom reporting and troubleshooting purposes

• Maintain and adhere to information security standards and protocols, as directed by Global Relay’s Information Security Policies

• Understands importance of quality control, information integrity, completeness and accuracy of data

• Administrative Perform case management using a ticket system including: creation, action and closure of assigned import tickets

• Provide accurate completion timelines and project milestone estimates, and deliver accordingly

• Generate processing logs and summary reports for customer review and verification

• Research and document internal processes and industry knowledge on an ad hoc basis

• Act as a customer liaison to Development and Operation teams, escalating bugs, system failures and data issues as necessary

• Demonstrates ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical individuals

• Repetitive work required




Qualifications:




Required:

• Post-secondary education

• 1-3 years in a technical support role or equivalent work experience

• Experience in Microsoft Office, specifically Excel and Outlook

• Technical/desktop trouble-shooting skills and computer proficiency

• Logical, methodical and predictable in their work

• Self-starter with the ability to work independently under minimal supervision

• Exceptional organizational and problem-solving skills with proven accuracy and attention to detail

• Ability to meet strict deadlines, while balancing multiple tasks or projects

• Strong written and verbal communication in English

• Demonstrates technical aptitude and an appetite for continuous learning




Preferred:

• Undergraduate degree preferred

• Submitting a cover letter in addition to your resume is highly encouraged for this role




Company:

Global Relay offers compliance messaging and message management, including archiving, audit and e-discovery for the financial sector. Founded in 1999, the company is headquartered in Vancouver, British Columbia, CAN, with a team of 1001-5000 employees. The company is currently . Global Relay has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: Fábrica Santa Rita (F26) - Banco de Talentos Operador de Produção 2025
Description:
Descrição da vaga

Você é daquelas pessoas que gosta de jogar junto, ficar por dentro das inovações, solucionar problemas e aprender fazendo?

Na Alpargatas, com responsabilidade socioambiental e visão de futuro, levamos soluções únicas a uma escala global. Por isso, buscamos pessoas que encaram os desafios de uma forma simples, leve e direto ao ponto. Promovemos um ambiente de muita colaboração e que tenha como premissa o respeito entre todas as pessoas.

Diversidade, Equidade e Inclusão aqui na Alpa é inegociável. Nós respeitamos e valorizamos as diferenças, por isso, independente de idade, identidade de gênero, raça, etnia, orientação sexual, origem nacional ou deficiência, convidamos você a fazer parte da nossa jornada.

Se você se identifica com nosso jeito de ser e tem garra pra fazer acontecer todos os dias junto com a gente, vem fazer parte do nosso time de PRODUÇÃO!

Requisitos e qualificações

Ensino médio completo

Disponibilidade para trabalhar em qualquer horário

Informações adicionais

Benefícios

Aqui Na Alpa, Nos Preocupamos Com a Saúde e o Bem-estar Das Nossas Pessoas E, Por Isso, Esperamos Que Você Tenha Tudo o Que Precisa Para Ter Uma Experiência Incrível Junto Com a Gente. Confira Os Nossos Benefícios


Plano de Saúde
Restaurante na Fábrica
Vale Transporte ou Fretado
Plano Odontológico (Odontosystem)
Convênio farmácia (Goodcard)
Seguro de Vida
Previdência Privada
Desconto em Produtos Havaianas
Gympass
Auxilio Funeral
Kit Bebê
Incentivo aos Estudos
Empréstimo Consignado
Participação nos Resultados
Brinde Aniversário


Sobre a Alpargatas

Somos uma empresa global, fundada e sediada no Brasil há mais de 115 anos. Nos comprometemos a encantar o mundo com marcas incríveis, que transmitem leveza e alegria para o dia a dia dos nossos consumidores.

Somos donos da marca Havaianas, conhecida por seus icônicos chinelos que representam, brasilidade, conforto e estilo. Temos 49,2% da Rothy´s, marca norte-americana de calçados sustentáveis.

A marca Havaianas é uma das maiores marcas de calçados abertos do mundo, com presença e atuação relevante em dezenas de países. Já a Rothy’s está presente nos Estados Unidos.

Nosso crescimento é pautado em sustentabilidade economia, sempre prezando pela responsabilidade socioambiental da nossa operação. Nossa cadeia de suprimentos é vertical, com quatro unidades fabris no Brasil, e somos donos da ioasys, nossa empresa de transformação digital.

Somos mais de 10 mil colaboradores, apaixonados por fazer acontecer, que visam inspirar o mundo com uma pegada mais leve.

Title: MOTORISTA CATEGORIA E - JOÃO PESSOA/PB
HTML:
Bem-vindo ao futuro, ao progresso, ao sustentável.

Aqui somos mais do que uma empresa que entrega o combustível que você precisa, aqui somos os apaixonados por segurança e aviação.

Hoje, somos consideradas uma das líderes no setor, com destaque na venda de QAV (querosene de aviação) e de AVGAS (gasolina de aviação), e também com uma das maiores frotas de carretas e caminhões segregadas para o transporte de produtos perigosos do Brasil.

Somos responsáveis pelo abastecimento com qualidade e segurança em quase 40 aeroportos espalhados pelo país. Investindo sempre na alta qualificação dos nossos operadores e vendas boca-tanque e a granel.

Especializada em transporte de combustíveis, estamos em todo território nacional atuando em áreas remotas nas densas florestas amazônicas, com difícil acesso atendendo agricultores, aeroportos, aeroclubes, usinas, termoelétrica, usinas de álcool, usina de biodiesel e outros dentro do seguimento.

Sobre o processo seletivo:

ATIVIDADES:

  • Conduzir com segurança veículos automotores destinados ao transporte de cargas;
  • Recolher o veículo à garagem ou local destinado quando concluída a jornada do dia;
  • Comunicar qualquer defeito que o veículo apresente;
  • Manter uma rotina de manutenção preventiva dos veículos;
  • Ter responsabilidade pelas operações de transporte, carga e descarga de produtos;
  • Manter o veículo em plenas condições para operar.

REQUISITOS:

  • CNH, categoria E;
  • Curso MOPP;
  • Direção Defensiva;
  • Direção Econômica;
  • Desejável - Ensino Médio;
  • Desejável: NR-20, NR-23, NR-35.

Description:

Carga e descarga de mercadorias;
Verificar adequação da carga para movimentação com empilhadeiras, carregando-a de acordo com sua capacidade;
Realizar as movimentações verticais e horizontais de produtos, equipamentos e outros tipos de carga;
Outras atividades relativas a função.

Local de trabalho: Cabedelo, PB

Title: Operador de Empilhadeira
HTML:
Operar máquina empilhadeira transportando e organizando materiais comercializados pela empresa, armazenamento e separando carga para estocagem, abastecimento e expedição de produtos, de maneira a facilitar a movimentação dos itens armazenados, garantindo a fidedignidade da expedição, sem que haja extravio ou perda de mercadorias.

Responsabilidades e atribuições

  • Receber mercadorias, realizando a descarga do caminhão e organizando-as no setor em acordo com as normas estabelecidas pela empresa;
  • Armazenar produtos e materiais de acordo com as normas estabelecidas pela organização;
  • Carregar veículo para transporte dos pedidos;
  • Manter local de estocagem limpo e organizado;
  • Prevenir e controlar perdas e avarias;
  • Participar do inventário/balanço do estoque, quando solicitado, confrontando a posição física dos produtos com as quantidades em sistema, para efeitos de controle e contabilização;
  • Monitorar condições de funcionamento do equipamento durante a operação;
  • Identificar carga movimentada;
  • Separar acessórios dos equipamentos;
  • Movimentar carga conforme normas de segurança específicas;
  • Selecionar equipamentos de movimentação de acordo com a carga;
  • Conferir conteúdos, peso e volumes de cargas;
  • Identificar situações inseguras de armazenagem;
  • Inspecionar itens básicos de funcionamento dos equipamentos de movimentação de cargas;
  • Inspecionar o local de acondicionamento da carga;
  • Testar funcionamento de equipamentos;
  • Utilizar os acessórios do equipamento de movimentação de acordo com o tipo de carga;
  • Interpretar a simbologia das embalagens;
  • Auto avaliar condições psicofísicas antes da execução do trabalho;
  • Carregar o equipamento de acordo com sua capacidade;
  • Controlar velocidade e sentido de operação de equipamentos;
  • Identificar características da carga para o transporte e armazenamento;
  • Certificar-se para movimentação de cargas especiais;
  • Programar sequência de movimentação;
  • Identificar disfunções e avarias;
  • Retirar obstáculos do ambiente de trabalho;
  • Requisitar manutenção de equipamento de trabalho, quando necessário;
  • Delimitar área para a movimentação de cargas;


Requisitos e qualificações

  • Ensino médio completo;
  • Habilitação B;
  • Curso de Operador de Empilhadeira;


Informações adicionais

Benefícios:

  • Vale Alimentação;
  • Plano de Saúde;
  • Assistência Odontológica;
  • Seguro de Vida;
  • Vale Transporte;
  • Voucher de aniversário;
  • Venda de produto com desconto para colaborador GMI;
  • Wellhub;
  • Conexa - Atendimento Psicológico e Nutricional;

Title: Farmacêutico(a) - Cabedelo
HTML:
Descrição da vaga

#SejaRDSaúde e vamos promover a saúde integral nesta profissão cheia de propósito e cuidado.

Com lojas espalhadas por todo país e líderes no mercado Brasileiro de farmácias, somos mais de 60 mil profissionais apaixonados e apaixonadas por cuidar de gente. Cada qual com nossas vivências, sonhos e conquistas. Trilhamos um caminho de desenvolvimento que impulsiona carreiras e transforma inúmeros amanhãs. Juntos por uma sociedade mais saudável, impactamos mais de um milhão de vidas todos os dias e queremos continuar crescendo de forma sólida e humana lado a lado com você.

Responsabilidades e atribuições

Serviços farmacêuticos, prevenção e controle, gestão de estoque, acompanhamento farmacêutico, dispensação de medicamentos, atendimento ao cliente, treinamento e supervisão da equipe, documentação e registro e conformidade com a legislação.

Requisitos e qualificações

  • Formação acadêmica mínima: Ensino superior completo em farmácia;
  • Faixa etária: mínimo 18 anos;
  • Registro: CRF ativo no estado;
  • Disponibilidade: Imediata, trabalho por escala;
  • Experiência: Não se preocupe se você ainda não tiver, a gente te ensina!

Informações adicionais

Trilha de carreira: 100% dos(as) gerentes da RD Saúde vieram de cargos de entrada e 50% são farmacêuticos(as). Demais, né? O melhor é que essa jornada da entrada até a liderança dura em média apenas 2 anos e 6 meses.

Salário e benefícios: Compatíveis com o mercado;

Local de trabalho: Farmácia (Loja);

Escala de trabalho: 8x48 - escala diferenciada e com folga dobradinha.

São mais de 40 benefícios pensados pra você e pra sua família.

  • Programa de Participação nos Resultados;
  • Trilha de carreira;
  • Convênio com empresas parceiras;
  • Seguro de vida;
  • Vale transporte;
  • Vale refeição e/ou alimentação;
  • Cesta de Natal;
  • Benefício farmácia e vacinação;
  • Assistência odontológica;
  • Assistência médica e telemedicina;
  • Auxilio-academia;
  • Licença maternidade e paternidade estendida;
  • Day Off de aniversário, no seu e dos filhos(as) + presente pra você;
  • Universidade com cursos pra você e família;
  • Fundo de emergência (apoio financeiro em momentos de crise);
  • Consultoria de planejamento e organização financeira;
  • Auxílio creche e kit bebê para mamães na RD Saúde;
  • Auxílio funeral;

Juntos por uma sociedade mais saudável

Somos RD Saúde, um ecossistema de saúde integral, com mais de 3 mil unidades em todo o Brasil e negócios em saúde que dividem o mesmo propósito: contribuir para uma sociedade mais saudável. Nossa jornada começou em novembro de 2011, fruto da união entre Raia e Drogasil, crescendo até se tornar a maior rede de farmácias do Brasil e expandindo para além do varejo farmacêutico, integrando soluções B2B e plataformas digitais.

Com mais de um milhão de vidas atendidas diariamente em todo o país, cuidar de perto dos(as) nossos(as) clientes e das nossas pessoas está em nosso DNA. Somos mais de 57 mil profissionais comprometidos em construir o futuro da saúde com calor humano e tecnologia. Temos a sustentabilidade no centro da nossa estratégia, dividindo nossa ambição em três pilares: pessoas, negócio e planeta mais saudáveis.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What You'll Do:


Partner with commercial teams to create and deliver Client Business Reviews, including custom analyses, optimization recommendations, media plans and forecasts to improve performance and drive incremental revenue
Design, manage, analyze, and communicate results of controlled A/B tests
Create and share market trends and benchmarks to support in strategic planning
Collaborate with Product Analytics to execute on performance-improving initiatives
Influence the Product Roadmap by sharing client needs and feedback with our product and R&D teams
Leverage the partnership with our Global Client Operations Center to identify ways to improve efficiency in executing tasks through automation or delegation
Develop expertise on a key growth area of the business.
Take ownership over knowledge sharing within the team and building client facing collateral
Troubleshoot campaign delivery and performance issues in time-sensitive, high-impact scenarios
Stay informed on industry trends and advancements in AdTech, analytics, forecasting, and attribution
Effectively communicate with teams and managers on project timelines and challenges



Who You Are:


Minimum 1 year full-time, analytics-relevant work experience with Python; previous experience with MySQL preferred
Native-level English fluency and strong presentation and public speaking skills, with the ability to present and defend complex analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Conceptual and practical understanding of statistics and real-world application of statistical concepts particularly in a testing context
Experience with internet advertising technology (tagging, cookies, trafficking) and digital marketing concepts is preferred



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we’d love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world’s marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

For employees based in the US, certain roles at Criteo are eligible for additional rewards, including quarterly or annual bonus and restricted stock units. US-based employees receive access to healthcare, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, family forming and wellness benefits, Flexible Work financial support, learning opportunities, and a robust annual leave plan including volunteer time off and summer vacation days.

The US base salary pay range for this position per year is:

$79,700 - $98,000

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Analyst




We are seeking a highly skilled and analytical Data Analyst with specialized expertise in Statistical Reporting within the Property & Casualty (P&C) insurance domain. The ideal candidate will be instrumental in extracting, transforming, and analyzing complex insurance data to generate critical statistical reports, support regulatory compliance, and drive strategic business decisions. This role requires a strong proficiency in SQL, particularly with DB2 databases, and advanced data mining skills.




Bachelor’s degree in actuarial science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field. Master's degree preferred.
Proven 3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, with a strong focus on Statistical Reporting in the Property & Casualty insurance industry.
Expert-level proficiency in SQL, with significant hands-on experience querying large datasets on DB2 databases is essential.
Demonstrated experience with data mining techniques and tools to uncover insights from complex datasets.
Familiarity with P&C insurance products (e.g., Auto, Home, Commercial), policy lifecycle, claims processes, and relevant industry statistical plans (e.g., ISO, NCCI) is highly desirable.
Proficiency with data visualization and BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Qlik Sense) is a plus.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Posting Description

ASSOCIATE DATA ANALYST, Credit Union , supports organization business and department objectives through collecting, evaluating and reporting member and sales data. With guidance from AVP, Data Analytics and Program Support the ADA will help maintain Arkalytics (DataLake), DNA CRM/BI tool and all data related systems to help research trends, support opportunities and measure program effectiveness; proactively support outreach programs through any type of list generation and providing ad-hoc analysis; ensure consistency within the organization in applying a set of projects and process improvement standards; and share knowledge, provide, and serve as resource to project teams and management on tools, methods and best practices.

The Full Job Description Is Available Here .

Job Requirements

REQUIRED : Bachelor’s degree; a minimum of two years of administrative and/or project/program management experience; effective mathematical, language, problem solving, reasoning, writing and basic to complex numeric skills; intermediate to advanced SQL skills for data extraction and analysis; experience with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and Excel (pivottables, macros, advanced formulas); ability to handle multiple projects and work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment; and excellent typing, interpersonal and organizational skills. Job #25065-6

This hybrid role requires on-site presence. Employees are expected to work 3 days in the office and 2 days remotely each week.

7/11/2025

Title: Analyst II
Description:
We’re defining what it means to build and deliver the most extraordinary sports and entertainment experiences. Our global team is trailblazing new markets, developing cutting-edge products, and shaping the future of responsible gaming.

Here, “impossible” isn’t part of our vocabulary. You’ll face some of the toughest but most rewarding challenges of your career. They’re worth it. Channeling your inner grit will accelerate your growth, help us win as a team, and create unforgettable moments for our customers.

The Crown Is Yours

Using your experience in data analysis, communication and problem-solving skills, you will play a key role in partnering with a variety of internal teams to drive valuable insights and guidance that help support the launch of a new endeavor that represents the next evolution of our customer experience and market growth strategy. This role contributes to a new, high-impact initiative that will expand DraftKings’ offerings in innovative and customer-centric ways.

What you’ll do as an Analyst II


Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Product, Engineering, and Operations to identify opportunities to support a fast-paced go-to-market strategy, new user offer promotions, and customer spend.
Aid in the creation and delivery of tools and automation for stakeholders to enhance decision making processes.
Build highly detailed reports using strong Tableau skills to quickly diagnose trends within core success metrics and to inspire new ways of thinking about our customers and product.
Provide insights to stakeholders on strategies on new endeavors.
Analyze customer behavior and conduct experiments to measure the direct impact of new product initiatives.



What you’ll bring


At least 2 years of professional experience in Business Analytics or Data Science.
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or another relevant discipline; or equivalent experience.
Experience in SQL and/or Snowflake and strong proficiency in Tableau (or similar data visualization tool). Experience with R, Python, or other statistical programming languages is a plus.
Proven ability to translate complex analytical findings into actionable recommendations for partners through clear storytelling and impactful data visualizations.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment.



Join Our Team

We’re a publicly traded (NASDAQ: DKNG) technology company headquartered in Boston. As a regulated gaming company, you may be required to obtain a gaming license issued by the appropriate state agency as a condition of employment. Don’t worry, we’ll guide you through the process if this is relevant to your role.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is 76,800.00 USD - 96,000.00 USD, plus bonus, equity, and benefits as applicable. Our ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The compensation information displayed on each job posting reflects the range for new hire pay rates for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific pay range and how that was determined during the hiring process. It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

Title: Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for GovCIO. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Overview

GovCIO is currently hiring for a Data Analyst to support the Readiness & Employment System contract working towards creating training data for the contract. This position will be a fully remote position.

Responsibilities

Develops, creates, transforms, and models data to support the training efforts for the Readiness & Employment System. Provides support on system data and business rules to support creation of new or enhanced information for the RES Training team. May support data modeling and ETL design and development to populate new data structures, including data warehouses, operational data stores and data marts. Performs data validation to assure data quality within new and enhanced databases.


Analyzes and assesses existing source system data to design appropriate data-centric solutions.
May develop models for data marts and data stores.
Works closely with business stakeholders and source system owners to research data anomalies and provide recommendations for resolutions.
May support end users with specific ad hoc reporting and analytic needs to provide further insights on the data.


Qualifications

Required Skills and Experience


Bachelor's with 2-5 years (or commensurate experience)
Clearance Required: Suitability for Public Trust
2 to 5 years in Education or training


Preferred Skills And Experience


Attention to detail
Ability to work independently with minimal guidance and supervision
Experience working and managing in remote environments
Experience managing office tools such as Excel, Word, Teams

GovCIO is a team of transformers--people who are passionate about transforming government IT. Every day, we make a positive impact by delivering innovative IT services and solutions that improve how government agencies operate and serve our citizens.

But we can't do it alone. We need great people to help us do great things - for our customers, our culture, and our ability to attract other great people. We are changing the face of government IT and building a workforce that fuels this mission. Are you ready to be a transformer?

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Shields Health Solutions, we pride ourselves on our culture of inclusion, kindness, acceptance, and the difference we make in patients' lives every day. We are tremendously proud to consistently be certified as a ‘Great Place to Work’ several years in a row; we’ve been recognized as a Fortunes Best Workplaces in Healthcare™, Millennials™, and Women™; and a Becker’s Healthcare Top 150 Workplace.

Patients are at the heart of everything we do. We are committed to improving lives by ensuring seamless access to specialty medications, better health outcomes, and an enhanced care experience. That’s why more health system leaders trust us to deliver personalized support and comprehensive solutions that make specialty pharmacy more accessible for the patients who need it most. Through our proven Shields Performance Platform, we help drive the financial sustainability of health systems while prioritizing best-in-class outcomes that patients deserve. With a team of leaders in specialty pharmacy, a track record of success partnering with over 80 health systems, and an unwavering dedication to measurable results, we empower health systems to transform their specialty pharmacy into a driver of growth—ensuring every patient receives the best possible care.

As Shields Health Solutions continues to experience rapid growth and expand our partnerships with leading health systems across the country, we’re actively hiring to support our mission. Our expanding footprint means more opportunities to make a meaningful impact in patients’ lives—so we’re looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team and continue to grow with us.

HYBRID IN STOUGHTON, MA

Position Overview:

Shields Health Solutions is seeking a Data Analyst to join the Financial Analytics team, reporting to the Manager of Financial Analytics. This position involves developing and maintaining dashboards and reporting through Tableau and Excel to provide insight into the organization’s performance. Along with this, the Data Analyst will partner directly with department heads to perform weekly and monthly analyses along with ad hoc reporting to identify organization insight. They will proactively recommend reporting, process, and infrastructure improvements. They will automate business and reporting processes and partner with internal teams to improve workflow. This role offers visibility across the corporate team and interaction with key business leaders to support critical business processes, information generation, and insights.

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience working with complex data, excellent communication skills, and possess advanced-level Tableau and Excel skills.

Key Responsibilities


Perform weekly and monthly reporting updates, ensuring data quality and availability
Be responsible for the development and maintenance of Tableau dashboards and Excel reports
Partner with functional leaders to uncover and capture opportunities to improve organizational efficiency
Proactively identify and communicate new ideas or enhancements to existing reports, metrics, and analyses to measure and track business performance
Assist in developing automated reporting processes to streamline analysis
Become a subject matter expert and make recommendations to impact tracking of information necessary to drive business results
Develop and maintain technical documentation to describe and memorialize information with respect to systems, reporting or data
Troubleshoot reporting and process issues, test and work with business to resolve any issues
Support team & organizational goals as needed


Education & Experience


2+ years of experience as data or business intelligence analyst, developer, or engineer
2+ years of developing dashboard, reporting and data processes using Tableau and Tableau Prep
Experience in communicating insight and technical processes to non-technical and executive audiences
Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills
Experience in owning reporting products and driving development projects
Must be a highly motivated, results-driven professional with an entrepreneurial attitude who can thrive in a team-oriented environment
Growth-oriented and positive, problem-solving mindset
Highly analytical with strong attention to detail; methodical thinker
Effective at multi-tasking; someone who enjoys and thrives wearing multiple hats at once, seeks exposure to different perspectives, and learning new skills
Customer service oriented, flexible and adaptable with proven ability to solve problems in a collaborative manner with strong ability to influence
Experience with Python and R a plus


Education:


Bachelor’s Degree in STEM, finance, business administration, or computer science required
Advanced degree a plus


California residents employed by or applying for work at Shields have certain privacy rights. Please review our: California Workforce Privacy Notice and Privacy Policy.

Shields Health Solutions provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Title: Data Analyst II
Description:
Under general supervision, designs and implements processes and solutions associated with a wide variety of data sets used for data/text mining, analysis to enable informed business decisions. Gains insight into key business problems and deliverables by applying statistical analysis techniques to examine structured and unstructured data from multiple disparate sources. Uses current and emerging technologies to evaluate trends and develop actionable insights and recommendations to management, via an increasing understanding of the business model and the information available for analysis. Typically uses data, statistical and quantitative analysis, and fact-based management to drive decision- making.

Create and implement data governance standards, policies, and procedures. Evaluate current state metadata capture strategies and implement process improvements. Develop and implement strategies and solutions to remediate identified data management and data governance concerns Evaluating and enforcing data governance standards across cloud analytics environments. Understanding and translating business definitions into fully classified descriptions while working closely with Data Stewards. Identifying and assessing data quality metrics. Clearly articulating data architecture/modeling techniques and concepts profiling data and derive context.

Minimum Education

Bachelor's degree in information systems, computer science, or a quantitative discipline such as mathematics, engineering, operations research, economics or Finance.

Minimum Experience

Two (2) years work experience in measurement and analysis, quantitative business problem solving, operations analysis, marketing analysis, simulation development and/or predictive analytics. Proficient in analytics software and applications.

Knolwedge, Skills And Abilities

Experience with Data Governance offerings such as: Collibra, Ab Initio, Purview or similar tools, Good interpersonal skills, Good written and oral communication skills.

Preferred Qualifications

Pay Transparency: This compensation range is provided as a reasonable estimate of the current starting salary range for this role across all potential locations. If this opportunity includes multiple job levels, the range is a reasonable estimate of the current starting salary for the lowest level to the current starting salary of the highest level. Actual starting pay would be determined by experience relative to the job, market level, pay at the location for this job and other job-related factors permitted by law. An employee may be eligible for additional pay, premiums, or bonus potential. The Company offers eligible employees health, vision and dental insurance, retirement, and tuition reimbursement.

Pay: U.S Pay Range: $5,960.00 - $8,940.00 (Monthly)

Additional Details: Application Criteria: Upload a current copy of Resume (Microsoft Word or PDF format only) and answer job screening questionnaire by 5 PM CT on July 30th, 2025

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Business Intelligence Analyst

Job Location: Marlborough MA 01752

Onsite Requirements: Hybrid

3+ years of experience in Business Analysis or BI roles, with a focus on Data Warehousing and Power BI.
Proficient in Power BI (Power Query, DAX, Power BI Service, and Dataflows).
Strong SQL skills and understanding of data modeling (star/snowflake schemas).

Job Description:

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and understand business data requirements.
Design, document, and validate data models and business logic within Data Warehouses.
Build and maintain interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations in Power BI.
Translate business questions into technical queries using DAX and SQL.
Perform data profiling, cleansing, and validation to ensure high data quality.
Develop KPIs, metrics, and performance indicators aligned with business goals.
Automate reporting and analysis processes to increase efficiency and accuracy.
Conduct user training and provide ongoing support for Power BI users.
Work closely with data engineers and architects to ensure optimal data structure and ETL performance.
Monitor and troubleshoot data refresh issues and data integrity concerns in Power BI Service.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Systems, Business Analytics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in Business Analysis or BI roles, with a focus on Data Warehousing and Power BI.
Proficient in Power BI (Power Query, DAX, Power BI Service, and Dataflows).
Strong SQL skills and understanding of data modeling (star/snowflake schemas).
Hands-on experience working with cloud-based and on-prem data platforms (e.g., Azure Synapse, SQL Server or similar).
Knowledge of ETL processes and tools (SSIS, ADF, or similar)

**3rd party and subcontract staffing agencies are not eligible for partnership on this position. 3rd party subcontractors need not apply.
This position requires candidates to be eligible to work in the United States, directly for an employer, without sponsorship now or anytime in the future**
